WRITING.TITLE: Can anyone help me figure out what this movie is called?
WRITING.TEXT:
So, one late night when I was a little kid, the TV was on in my living room, where me, my brother, and my Dad crashed for the night. I remember it being a cheesy 70s-80s horror movie and being terrified by it at that age. I want to watch it again so I can laugh at probably how bad it is.
So what I remember from the movie is that it:
A. Is a horror flick from the 70s-80s.
B. It has this big orange monster.
C. I remember it being gore-y, I think.
D. It took place in some sort of camping site. I think the orange monster came in and started to eat people.
Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: What other movies could take place within the Alien/Predator/Blade Runner/Ghost in the Shell universe?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey so for some time now I've been trying to get a timeline together of a possible shared universe between movies. Now, obviously Alien, Predator, and Blade Runner are set in the same mythos, but when I watched the 1996 version of Ghost in the Shell, I realized that it could totally take place within the same universe as Blade Runner, being that Major is a replicant, and then therefore it would be tied to the other films as well.
I want this timeline to grow and have so many other movies in it, so do you guys think any other movies would work? Here's what I got so far:
1. Predator 2. Predators 3. Alien vs. Predator 4. Alien vs. Predator: Requiem 5. Predators 6. Blade Runner 7. Ghost in the Shell (1996) 8. Blade Runner 2049 9. Prometheus 10. Alien: Covenant 12. 11. Alien 13. Aliens 14. Alien 3 15. Alien: Ressurrection
I did originally have Ex Machina set in here, which would have been the film that shows the creation of the replicants and how they became unleashed to the world, but sadly I found out that I guess the film takes place in the 2020s, which wouldn't line up as replicants were created in the mid-2010s.
EDIT 1: I'm actually now thinking that Back to the Future could fit in this universe. It all fits together, right? There are flying cars in 2015 in Back to the Future Part II, and they also exist in 2019 in Blade Runner.
EDIT 2: Also, I'm thinking 2001: A Space Odyssey could also make sense in this timeline. Replicants wouldn't be created until the mid-2010s, but the first computer AI could have been created beforehand. I mean, replicants are clearly more sophisticated than Hal 9000.
EDIT 3: I'm adding in Seinfeld. Why? Well, it's amazing, and it also doesn't contradict anything considering it's a show about nothing, so I'm putting it in god dammit!

Abraham Lincoln because he freed the slaves and tried his best to bring unity. He also claimed to never tell a lie, and I would like to assume this is true.
